metadata.title: CVE-2021-45481 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In WebKitGTK before 2.32.4, there is incorrect memory allocation inWebCore::ImageBufferCairoImageSurfaceBackend::create, leading to asegmentation violation and application crash, a different vulnerabilitythan CVE-2021-30889.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
